comment: Kelly Edenfield might be one of the worst professors I've ever taken. She expects us to be able to read her mind when it comes to the expectations she has for assignments. The in-class portion was fine, but the homework unnecessary. She also did not understand what she was teaching to us, and she told us that multiple times. 0/10 I'm not a fan LMON
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Edenfield is a really nice, caring person. The FYOS has busy work, just make sure that you stay on top of deadlines, about 2 easy papers, and weekly short assignments, some non-mandatory.
This class had too much work for a FYOS. Everything is busy work and honestly really unnecessary. She grades harshly.

She is SO unclear about what she expects on assignments. She will give terrible grades for things that fully meet the given instructions because the instructions did not fully convey her intentions for the assignments. She is very unreasonable and assigns SO much busy work. She is a great example of what we are taught not to be as future educators!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Edenfield was my most challenging professor, but I learned the most from her. She wants all of her students to be successful teachers and because of this, she requires you to work hard. This class is not an easy A, but you will learn a lot. Please take advantage of her office hours and email her if you have any issues.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: I took Dr. Edenfield for MATH 3317 and 3318 this semester. She is a great professor. Wants to make sure you understand the information and can apply it in future classrooms. Unfortunately, she will not be teaching after this semester!
